page.title: 09EARDINGTON SHROPSHIRE
page.content: { Eardington}is a small linear village about 1\ miles from Bridgnorth.It lies on the west bank of the R.Severn, on a minor road leading from the B4364.To the east of the village runs the {Severn Valley Steam Railway},a popular tourist attraction. The village is{mainly residential, including a fair number of retired folk.The few jobs available are in the shop /post office,the abbatoir and on surrounding farms.It also has a coach depot for a local small company.Many of the residents commute to the West Midlands conurbation and Bridgnorth. Eardington used to have a pub called the Red Crown but it has closed down. (Shame!).A recent addition to the village has been the building of a group of retirement homes linked to a warden's house.
